Interface com.icl.saxon.ElementInfo

public interface ElementInfo
A node in the XML parse tree representing an element.

The ElementInfo provides information about the element and its context. Information available includes the tag and attributes of the element, and pointers to the parent element and the previous element at the same level.

It is also possible to associate user data with the ElementInfo; user data set while processing the start tag of the element may be accessed, for example, when processing the children of the element or the end tag of the element.

SAXON processes a document serially and heirarchically. Because of this, you can only access information about elements that have already been processed, and information about an element is discarded as soon as its parent element is closed.

format(String)
Format a string with substitution parameters
getAncestor(String)
Get the nearest ancestor element with a given tag
getAttribute(String)
Find the value of a given attribute of this element.
Note this is a short-cut method; the full capability to examine attributes is offered via the getAttributeList() method
getAttributeList()
Get the attribute list for this element.
getElementInDOM()
Get the corresponding element in the DOM.
getExtendedAttribute(String)
Find the most recent value of a given attribute of this element.

Find the most recent value of a given attribute of a given element.

Get the first element of this group.

Get the element handler for this element

Find the parent of this element.

Get the previous sibling of the element.

Get the tag of this element

Get the user data for the element

Get the Writer used for this element instance

Determine whether the parent of this element is an element of a specified type.

Determine whether this element is the first child of its parent.
isFirstOfType()
Determine whether this element is the first in a consecutive group.
isRoot()
Determine whether this element is the root.

Set the value of a (pseudo-) attribute of this element.

Set the value of a (pseudo-) attribute of a given element.
setUserData(Object)
Set the user data for the element
setWriter(Writer)
Set the writer for this element instance.
This affects subsequent output produced for this element instance, and overrides any Writer set for the element type using Distributor.setWriter().

getElementInDOM 
 public abstract Element getElementInDOM()
Get the corresponding element in the DOM. This will only work if the BUILD_DOM option was set. Otherwise it returns null

getAttributeList 
 public abstract AttributeList getAttributeList()
Get the attribute list for this element.

Returns:
The attribute list (as in the SAX interface)
getUserData 
 public abstract Object getUserData()
Get the user data for the element

Returns:
The user data object. Returns null if setUserData() has not been called for this element.
setUserData 
 public abstract void setUserData(Object userData)
Set the user data for the element

Parameters:
userData - an object to be saved with this element, which can be retrieved later using getUserData().
getWriter 
 public abstract Writer getWriter()
Get the Writer used for this element instance

Returns:
the Writer used for output from this element. This will be:
  • A writer provided for the element instance using ElementInfo.setWriter(), if any;
  • Otherwise, a writer provided for the element type using Distributor.setWriter(), if any;
  • Otherwise, the writer being used for the parent element.
The default Writer for the root element is System.out
setWriter 
 public abstract void setWriter(Writer writer)
Set the writer for this element instance.
This affects subsequent output produced for this element instance, and overrides any Writer set for the element type using Distributor.setWriter(). It will be used for subsequent output for this element, and for any subsequent child element unless the child element type has a Writer explicitly registered for it. It will automatically be closed when the element ends.

Parameters:
writer - The Writer to be used for output from this element instance
write 
 public abstract void write(String s) throws SAXException
Produce output using the appropriate Writer for this element

Parameters:
s - The String to be output
write 
 public abstract void write(char ch[],
                            int start,
                            int length) throws SAXException
Produce output using the appropriate Writer for this element

Parameters:
ch - Character array to be output
start - start position of characters to be output
length - number of characters to be output
writeEscape 
 public abstract void writeEscape(String s) throws SAXException
Produce output using the appropriate Writer for this element, escaping special characters using XML/HTML conventions

Parameters:
s - The String to be output
writeEscape 
 public abstract void writeEscape(char ch[],
                                  int start,
                                  int length) throws SAXException
Produce output using the appropriate Writer for this element, escaping special characters using XML/HTML conventions

Parameters:
ch - Character array to be output
start - start position of characters to be output
length - number of characters to be output
getPreviousSibling 
 public abstract ElementInfo getPreviousSibling()
Get the previous sibling of the element.

Returns:
The ElementInfo object describing the previous element at the same level. Returns null if the current element is the first child of its parent, or if it is the root element.
getAttribute 
 public abstract String getAttribute(String name)
Find the value of a given attribute of this element.
Note this is a short-cut method; the full capability to examine attributes is offered via the getAttributeList() method

Parameters:
name - the name of an attribute
Returns:
The value of the attribute, if it exists, otherwise null
getExtendedAttribute 
 public abstract String getExtendedAttribute(String element,
                                             String name)
Find the most recent value of a given attribute of a given element. This can be used to find the value of an attribute of this element, of an element that encloses this element, or of any element whose start tag has been processed: but only the for the most recent element of its type. It can also be used to retrieve "pseudo-attributes" that have been attached to an element using setExtendedAttribute().

Parameters:
element - The name (tag) of the element
name - The name of the attribute or pseudo-attribute. There are two special attribute names: "#" for the element number, and "<>" for the character content.
Returns:
The value of the attribute, if it exists, otherwise null
setExtendedAttribute 
 public abstract void setExtendedAttribute(String element,
                                           String name,
                                           String value)
Set the value of a (pseudo-) attribute of a given element. This affects subsequent calls of getExtendedAttribute() for that element.

Parameters:
element - The name (tag) of the element. Note, there is no check that this represents a real element in the document. If it does, the attribute value will overwrite any value for the attribute that was actually present on that element
name - The name of an attribute or pseudo-attribute. This does not need to be a well-formed or valid attribute name for the element type. There are two special attribute names: "#" for the element number, and "<>" for the character content.
Returns:
The value of the attribute, if it exists, otherwise null
getExtendedAttribute 
 public abstract String getExtendedAttribute(String name)
Find the most recent value of a given attribute of this element. It can also be used to retrieve "pseudo-attributes" that have been attached to an element using setExtendedAttribute().

Parameters:
name - The name of the attribute or pseudo-attribute. There are two special attribute names: "#" for the element number, and "<>" for the character content.
Returns:
The value of the attribute, if it exists, otherwise null
setExtendedAttribute 
 public abstract void setExtendedAttribute(String name,
                                           String value)
Set the value of a (pseudo-) attribute of this element. This affects subsequent calls of getExtendedAttribute() for that element.

Parameters:
name - The name of an attribute or pseudo-attribute. This does not need to be a well-formed or valid attribute name for the element type. There are two special attribute names: "#" for the element number, and "<>" for the character content.
Returns:
The value of the attribute, if it exists, otherwise null
getTag 
 public abstract String getTag()
Get the tag of this element

Returns:
The element tag as a String
getHandler 
 public abstract ElementHandler getHandler()
Get the element handler for this element

Returns:
The element handler
format 
 public abstract String format(String pattern)
Format a string with substitution parameters

Parameters:
pattern - String containing place-markers to be expanded. Place markers are marked by enclosing underscores and take the form:
  • «element/attribute»: The value of the given attribute on the current or most recent instance of the given element. This is the same value as getExtendedAttribute() would return. (Zero-length string if there is no value for the attribute)
  • «element/#»: The element number assigned to the element using the setNumbering() method of class Renderer
  • «»element/*»: The value of the character content of the element. (This is only available once some character content has been read)
Returns:
String after substitution.
getParent 
 public abstract ElementInfo getParent()
Find the parent of this element.

Returns:
The ElementInfo object describing the parent element. Returns null if this element is the root.
getAncestor 
 public abstract ElementInfo getAncestor(String tag)
Get the nearest ancestor element with a given tag

Parameters:
tag - The tag of the required ancestor element
Returns:
The ElementInfo for the nearest ancestor with the given tag; null if there is no such ancestor
isFirstOfType 
 public abstract boolean isFirstOfType()
Determine whether this element is the first in a consecutive group. A consecutive group is a group of elements of the same type subordinate to the same parent element; there can be intervening character data, white space, or processing instructions, but no elements of a different type.

Returns:
True if this is the first child of its parent, or if the previous child was a different element type, or if this element is the root.
isFirstChild 
 public abstract boolean isFirstChild()
Determine whether this element is the first child of its parent.

Returns:
True if this element is the first child of its parent, or if it is the root element.
getFirstInGroup 
 public abstract ElementInfo getFirstInGroup()
Get the first element of this group. A group is a consecutive sequence of one or more elements of the same type, subordinate to the same parent element. There may be intervening character data but no intervening elements of a different type.

Returns:
The ElementInfo for the first element in the group. This may, of course, be the current element.
hasParent 
 public abstract boolean hasParent(String tag)
Determine whether the parent of this element is an element of a specified type.

Parameters:
tag - The putative tag of the parent element type
Returns:
True if the parent element has the specified tag. Return False if this element is the root.
isRoot 
 public abstract boolean isRoot()
Determine whether this element is the root.

Returns:
True if this element is the root element.
